speaker: Griffin
lines: Previously on The Adventure Zone,

speaker: Director
lines: The Bureau of Balance has a singular purpose, and that is to collect and destroy weapons of mass destruction what we call The Grand Relics. You will be reassigned to lodging more deserving of your accomplishments, and to that end we’ve hired a new seeker whose sole responsibility will be providing you with live intel when you’re hunting down a Grand Relic.

speaker: Angus
lines: Hello sirs!

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s the boy detective! It’s Angus!

speaker: Lucas
lines: We don’t know anything about this creature, and we’re putting all of our faith into it!? My name is Lucas.

speaker: Taako and Merle
lines: Lucas Humanman...

speaker: Lucas
lines: And-and I’m asking him to let me take it back to my lab and just see if I can figure out what makes it tick.

lines: [laughing] So are you part of the Bureau of Balance or what?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You eye him over, he does not have a bracer.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, I do not like this guy.

speaker: The Announcer
lines: Where is our campaign going next? A haunted amusement park? A haunted...candy factory? I don’t know, it’s The Adventure Zone!

lines: "Déjà Vu" by Mort Garson]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let’s start producing content together, the four of us.

speaker: Clint
lines: Content time!

speaker: Travis
lines: [under his breath] Contented, contented.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughs] Time to make the content. The- we’re about to start a new leg of our adventure, do you guys have any ideas as to where I’m about to whisk you away?

lines: If I have learned one thing in the ensuing year since we began this podcast, it is don’t try to guess [starts laughing] where Griffin is taking this trip!

lines: Where do you want-

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh shit.

lines: Yeah, uh-

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s like when Leo DiCaprio came on Growing Pains. Pretty soon the franchise isn’t gonna be about the three of you chuckle-fucks at all. It’s gonna be all Angus all the time. Dad, how are you feeling by the way? Let’s do a quick dad health check.

lines: I- I feel much better, thank you to the outpouring of love and a little bit of hatred that came from all of our listeners-

lines: Welcome to podcasting!

lines: You still–

lines: Well I’m gonna- I guess I’ll be in character voice the whole time.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s- that is fair.

lines: Kind of like Bessie Smith.

lines: Uh, enough tiddly-shittin’ around.

lines: Uh, before we start this- this leg of the adventure, um, I have an important question for all three of you and that is, what did you get each other?

lines: Wha?

lines: Oh!

lines: What synergy!

lines: All around Faerun, it’s actually a different Candlenights, it’s not quite the same as the one that we celebrate here on Earth prime. Uh, but it is Candlenights, it’s a weeklong holiday celebration, you know the world of The Adventure Zone is about as pan-religious as it gets, so everybody just kind of stopped doing their own, you know, ritual celebrations ‘cause it got sort of complicated, tracking who was-who was partying down on what and everything just kind of organically congealed into one super-holiday.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m gonna catch dad up on Candlenights super quick. Dad, do you remember all the Christmases we spent together as a family, uh, gathered around the tree and singing songs of Yule and basking in each other’s love?

lines: [deadpan] No.

lines: Okay, let’s try that again and you say yes to my fucking bit-

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, right! Got it, okay, sorry.

lines: -Yeah, do it, and learn to do a joke for fucking once.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright, sorry. Okay. [clears throat]

speaker: Justin
lines: Dad, you remember all the times that we spent uh, gathered around the hearth, basking in the Christmastime Yule spirit of each other’s love?

speaker: Clint
lines: Aw, Justin, those are memories I’ll never be able to forget.

speaker: Justin
lines: Well turns out you're wasting our fucking time.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh.

speaker: Justin
lines: Cause just around the corner was a new holiday called Candlenights that was not only better, [Clint sighs, faking disappointment] than Christmas, it has absorbed Christmas and Hanukkah and every holiday.

lines: Like Katamari Damacy.

lines: I wondered why I hadn’t seen any TV commercials at all, hardly, about Christmas.

lines: [frantic] Please don’t ask Candlenights Santa questions that only Santa would know!

speaker: Griffin
lines: The Talented Mr. Santa Claus was my favorite Matt Damon/Tim Allen movie. It was about time that the two of them got together to work on a project. [Tim Allen grunt] Anyway, fantasy Candlenights shares a lot of the same sort of aesthetic inspirations as Candlenights because of its- because of its countless multiple religious sources, people just kind of do their own thing and it’s-

lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And they’re just cool with it. There’s usually a tree or bush involved, or any kind of like, lush plant. Um, but that’s about the only staple. And right now the three of you are gathered around your own Candlenights bush, um, and, uh, you’re havin’ a little Bureau of Balance holiday party.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is it like a white elephant, or like, uh, more of a secret Santa, or are we just doing a straight-up exchange-

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s more of just a straight-up exchange. The three of you are actually in your brand new dormitory suite that you got set up in after your pseudo-promotion in the last episode. Uh, it’s been about a month or two since your last adventure and yeah, it’s wintertime, it’s Candlenights, you’re in your dope suite, and it is dope, you’ve each got your own sort of private sleeping chambers that are attached-

lines: Bed? Our own bed?

lines: Our own rooms?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, your- your own, like, sleeping rooms and it attaches to a shared living room, it’s a big space, it is a big step up from basically the dorm room you were sharing with Robbie, uh, AKA Pringles, uh-

lines: AKA Jailbird, I miss that dude.

lines: Well, he’s in prison now, um-

lines: Uh, so yeah, you’re having this holiday party, and you've got a pretty big living space to host it in, the coolest thing about this living space and, uh, is why the Director was hyping it up so much, it’s actually on the bottom of the moon base. You’ve got like, your own private elevator leading down to your- to your private living suite and you’ve got like a big, dome glass window underneath you. Just sort of looking down into, uh, down towards the Earth that you are floating over.

speaker: Travis
lines: I wanna say that I know that this is a fantasy world in which Griffin is painting a picture with words, I literally just had like a real-life reaction [Clint laughs] to the idea of having a hole in the middle of my room that looks down thousands and thousands of feet-

lines: Ummm. Cinnam-

speaker: Leon
lines: Green, got it. Green, here you go. Green suit.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I feel like maybe there was uh. No point in asking?

speaker: Leon
lines: Listen, we don't have a lot of null suits.

speaker: Justin
lines: It really drives me crazy when DM’s don't fuckin just let people be creative.

speaker: Leon
lines: Oh no, look at the, oh wait no, look at this. I found a burgundy and a burnt umber and whatever dumb color Taako said. Cinnamon? Cinnamon? What, so you guys-

speaker: Merle
lines: No, we'll go with your choices.

speaker: Leon
lines: No, no no these are all--

speaker: Merle
lines: No there's a reason, I can tell there's a reason.

speaker: Leon
lines: No, there's no reason, it's just different dumb shades of red. Here you go, idiots.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So the three of you. I can't believe you all went with the red shirts but fine. You're all wearing different shades of red.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Burgundy's more purpley, but that's fine.

speaker: Leon
lines: Mmkay.

speaker: Merle
lines: I don't even know what burnt umber is.

speaker: Leon
lines: Yeah, I didn't think you did.

speaker: Taako
lines: And I thought I was ordering a latte. So, guess we all have egg on our face, huh?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He hands each of you suits that are tailored to fit. Not exactly tailored to fit, but they do fit.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is there room in the crotch?

speaker: Griffin
lines: There is ample space in the crotch.

speaker: Clint
lines: Not for me!

speaker: Griffin
lines: These suits sort of, they wrap around your whole body. And each of them comes with a glass — almost fish-bowl style helmet with a retractable visor on it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Sweet!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And each one has like a little panel in the wrist. Leon tells you to get inside the chamber and take all the weapons and items that you're gonna bring with you and set them down. He takes some of these hoses from the pedestal in the middle and then connects them to those panels in your wrists. And steps out and shuts the chamber. You see him turn a dial, and then all of a sudden this chamber is like sprayed by all of these different nozzles all around the chamber. You guys are secretly just getting a spray tan. Joke's on you.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, that's nice!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Your suits actually are filled with sort of a sharp, chemical smell--

speaker: Travis
lines: I farted.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh boy. That's gonna be the first of many jokes like that, I bet, in this campaign arc.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yep.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And when the process is ended, all of your belongings have been sprayed down with this material and your suit — the panel on your suit has a meter on it that was in the red before you sorta connected and got all filled up and is now filled all the way to green. And Leon says,

speaker: Leon
lines: So, with this, any transmutation magic that tries to affect you or any of the belongings you brought into the chamber are going to be impervious. Taako, unfortunately, this means any outbound transmutation spells aren't going to work. So keep that in mind.

speaker: Taako
lines: All right, seems fair.

speaker: Leon
lines: Also, the suit is extremely durable. But try not to let it get punctured because you inside of the suit are still vulnerable, but the suit itself will provide you protection from transmutation magic so long as you are wearing it.

speaker: Taako
lines: Got it.

speaker: Merle
lines: [hoarsely] Check.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So yeah after equipping these null suits-- Which don't bestow any armor benefits, they sorta go on over your armor. Sorry Magnus--

speaker: Travis
lines: Nah, it's cool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You make your way up to the hangar. This whole time the headquarters has been moving. Which has been sort of a nauseating effect. It typically moves a little bit in the night sky.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is it like a cruise ship thing? Where you don't notice it until you think about it and then you wanna puke?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes, exactly like, yeah. And it's also like when you're just sorta normally moving the normal route that your moonbase moves, it's very slow, but it has to move to sort of give the appearance to people on the ground that it's an actual moon. But imagine people on the ground just saw the moon at like, 90 miles an hour. Just turn-

speaker: Travis
lines: Just really hoofing it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Just turn 90 degrees in the night sky and start zippin. So yeah, there might be some ‘splaining to do later. But you've made your way to the hangar. And the back of the hangar's been sort of opened up and you-you see the night sky in front of you, it's snowing actually pretty hard. It's actually a pretty bad winter storm going on. And on the edge of this sort of dock are these two gondolas. Standing next to one of the gondolas you see Killian, who's also wearing a null suit. And she has two accomplices with her, one of which is a dragonborn woman. A fairly slight dragonborn as far as dragonborns go, they're usually pretty big dragon-lookin’ people. This is more of a lizard-born. And a dwarf, who, you're assuming it's a dwarf because it's a short, stout figure, but their glass helmet, like, is completely opaque. You can't see through it at all.

speaker: Travis
lines: All sounds great.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Killian motions to you over to the gondolas and she says,

speaker: Killian
lines: Oh, I want you guys to meet my regulators, my rollin' crew, my squad. This is Carey Fangbattle. She's a rogue, and she's damn good at what she does, rogue-like stuff.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Fangbattle.

speaker: Taako
lines: I've heard tale of your brother, uh, Scales?

speaker: Carey
lines: Oh man.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hold on I need a voice for her--

speaker: Carey
lines: [surfy voice] Oh man. You know about Jeremy? Yeah, he can be a real tool sometimes. Ha ha ha. That's not me though. I'm Carey Fangbattle. I'm a rogue. I'm the best there is at what I do. Rogue stuff. You know.

speaker: Taako
lines: No instrumentation whatsoever, huh?

speaker: Carey
lines: No, I didn't go the bard route. Which my dad wasn't so psyched about but hey, I’m good at rogue stuff! You know how I do my thing-

speaker: Magnus
lines: Rogue-ing around? Rogue-eo-

speaker: Merle
lines: Rogue-ery, you're good at rogue-ery?

speaker: Carey
lines: General rogue-ery, yeah. You know the point. Have you seen my brother-

speaker: Justin
lines: I bet that is kind of a bummer as a parent when your kid steals something and they're like, "Hey Deborah?" "Uh, yes Carl?" "She seemed...very proficient at that didn't she?" "Yeah she did seem very proficient at theft." "Ah, son of a bitch, she's a rogue." "Aw, man."

speaker: Griffin
lines: The dwarf opens up his helmet and a thick cloud of smoke comes out. And you see inside--

speaker: Clint
lines: Cheech and Chong!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No it's actually the gruffest looking dwarf you've ever seen. It's like if somebody put Merle through a meat grinder and just sorta schluffed him back together again and then like glued some hair onto him.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is it a female?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, it's a man and he's smoking a big cigar. And he says uh, [deep, gruff, breathy with pauses]

speaker: Dwarf
lines: Hello. Suppose introductions are in order.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Nah, it's not necessary.

speaker: Dwarf
lines: My name... is Boyland. [pronounced as the two words separately, boy-land]

speaker: Taako
lines: ‘scuse me?

speaker: Boyland
lines: What are ya laughin’ at? I mean I know what you’re-

speaker: Griffin
lines: Keep in mind this is the name of a real person that we borrowed for the show.

speaker: Magnus
lines: It's just your name was so cool that we were struck by it.

speaker: Boyland
lines: Ah yeah, it happens a lot. [trying to start a sentence]

speaker: Taako
lines: Boyyylaaaaannndd!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Boyland, can I just jump in here and-

speaker: Boyland
lines: It might- it might-

speaker: Magnus
lines: You look like shit.

speaker: Boyland
lines: It might be Boyland [pronounced boy-lund as in Newfoundland or the “y” sound in Brooklyn]

speaker: Taako
lines: Boylund makes more sense.

speaker: Merle
lines: [barely suppressing mirth] Go with Boylund, please.

speaker: Taako
lines: I don't wanna tell you how to say your name, Boyland, but like, maybe Boylund would be the way to go.

speaker: Boyland
lines: [Going back to what Magnus said] Did you just say I look like shit? It's just what I look like.

speaker: Magnus
lines: You kinda look like shit. Are you okay? You apparently look like my friend Merle here has been put through a meat grinder and had hair glued to him.

speaker: Boyland
lines: I think that's an accurate description, but I don't need to look good. I, let's just say I don't have a charisma-centric build.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Do you feel good?

speaker: Boyland
lines: Not on the inside.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh no, we're gonna have a lot to talk about, Boyland.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The Director is there too. And she walks over and holds out her pendant and Lucas addresses the assembly. And he says

speaker: Lucas
lines: So there are a few points of entry that you can conceivably get into the base through, but your best bet is the conservatory, I have a pretty big skylight there that was open when everything went down, so you should be able to get through there pretty easily. And once you're inside, just start making your way to the center of the facility, you'll find the medbay where I'm holed up. I'm in the main elevator lobby on the same floor as the conservatory. Just go- you just have to go through some of my lab facilities to get there from the conservatory. Also, if you can power them down as you go, you'll be able to free up some power that I can channel back into the suspension cores and buy us all some more time.

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin, when eventually we make a movie out of the Adventure Zone, will this be more of like an Ocean's Eleven style like? Like we'll see the corridors and lasers and stuff.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This is all completely original from my head. I didn't make any of it up based on stealing theft.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Angus chimes in through your Stones of Farspeech which you have tucked away inside your suits so you can sort of communicate. And you hear him say

speaker: Angus
lines: Be careful in there. According to the psych profile I've drawn up based on what the Director has told me about Lucas, he's a pretty reckless individual, and I'm willing to bet his experiments aren't above-board safety wise.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Cool.

speaker: Merle
lines: Is there any way to turn off the radio in the suits?

speaker: Angus
lines: I mean, I wouldn't advise it. I'm gonna provide some good helpful intel and some charming dialogue.

speaker: Merle
lines: [sighs]

speaker: Taako
lines: Can you at least try to talk a little lower, darling?

speaker: Angus
lines: [slightly lower] H-Hi.

speaker: Taako
lines: Butch it up a bit?

speaker: Angus
lines: Okay lemme. [lower, but also old and strained sounding?] Hi everybody, it's me Angus.

speaker: Merle
lines: Oh god, that's worse.

speaker: Angus
lines: [not much lower-pitched but slower] No, I'm here to provide you with valuable-

speaker: Merle and Taako
lines: Nooo, no--

speaker: Angus
lines: -valuable intel.

speaker: Taako
lines: No, it's like.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Lucas, it's Magnus here.

speaker: Taako
lines: It's like Will Ferrell's impersonation of Harry Caray fell down a flight of stairs.

speaker: Merle
lines: And landed on Grandpa Simpson.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ah, you-

speaker: Magnus
lines: Lucas, this- Magnus, here. Real quick, before we jump on down there into your … whatever lab of horrors, is there, ah you mentioned there were some robots [pronounced "robits"]... [Stammering] Are we gonna be facing any like crystalline monsters, or bad guys of any sort?

speaker: Lucas
lines: I didn't- I didn't, I mean. I mean, I didn't see anything? I just saw the lab around me sorta start to get all pink and crystally, and so I ran as fast as I could for the nearest airlock, so, I-

speaker: Magnus
lines: Real quick-

speaker: Travis
lines: I take a minute and I tell my shield of the story of the time I ripped a robit's arms off.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, yeah! It etches that into the face of it. The Director says,

speaker: The Director
lines: If-- you guys are gonna probably need this.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She takes off her necklace and hands it to- well she just hands it out into the three of your direction.

speaker: Travis
lines: I take it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay. And she says

speaker: The Director
lines: You'll probably need this to stay in touch.

speaker: Travis
lines: Now, Ditto, to be fair, we didn't have this when we did the null suit coating.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You can put it on underneath your suit.

speaker: Travis
lines: I put it on underneath my suit.

speaker: Merle
lines: Wait a minute wait a minute, you need help with the clasp, honey, turn around.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, you've got a visor that sort of slides upward and retracts pretty easily. So yeah, you are now able to stay in touch with Lucas, and Carey Fangbattle says

speaker: Carey
lines: All right guys, time to roll out! You guys ready to get busy-- Livin? Or get busy dyin'?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Ehm.. Yeah?

speaker: Merle
lines: Sure? [pause] Wait a minute. Dyin’?

speaker: [OUTRO MUSIC
lines: "Déjà Vu" by Mort Garson (full song on YouTube)]
